main_definition: Paper refers to a thin material produced by pressing together moist fibers derived from the pulped cellulose fiber of wood, rags, or grasses, often used for writing, printing, or packaging.

meanings_and_examples.example: I received a paper from my professor outlining the project requirements.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An official document that serves as proof of identity, ownership, or transaction
meanings_and_examples.example: She presented her birth certificate and driver's license to prove her age for purchasing alcohol.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A piece of news reported in a newspaper or other publication
meanings_and_examples.example: The local paper ran an article about the town hall meeting last night.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To test or examine something, usually by asking questions (similar to 'interrogate')
meanings_and_examples.example: During his interview for the job, he was asked a lot of probing questions; they really papered him.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A sheet made from pulped material and intended for writing or printing on
meanings_and_examples.example: He wrote an important letter on a clean piece of paper before sending it in the mail.
